intro: Tetraplandra longipetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled tetraplandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves with long petioles, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
